extent.note: The leaves are broader in their middle than at their edges.

supportDesc.condition: Excellent state of preservation. The leaves are not particularly well prepared.

handNote.p: Tamil script. The handwriting is not particularly neat. The manuscript does not use double-curled kompu, but, for some letters, a distinction is made through another device: a supplementary loop seems to indicate that the vowel is long, but only for ṟō றோ and ṉō னோ. This device is probably based on the analogy of the distinction made between initial o and initial ō or between ḷu and ḷū. The puḷḷi is used. Note the peculiar form of āytam (ḵ, ஃ in modern Tamil script), which looks like a modern kū, while another glyph, similar but different, is used for the letter kū.

origin.origDate: 1835 according to Cabaton (1912, p. 61). The reason for this date is unknown.

body.p: The manuscript contains a Tamil syllabary (U2). We find successively: the series of initial vowels (f1); the series of the 18 consonants with a vocalisation (ka, ṅa, ca, ña, ṭa, ṇa, ta, na, pa, ma, ya, ra, la, va, ḻa, ḷa, ṟa, and ṉa) (f2); the series of the 18 consonants (ka, ṅa, ca, ña, ṭa, ṇa, ta, na, pa, ma, ya, ra, la, va, ḻa, ḷa, ṟa, ṉa), given successively (1 folio per consonant), each with the different options for the vocalisation of the consonant and, as final sign, the consonant with puḷḷi (f3–f20).

The manuscript has been used. The original Tamil foliation has been “translated” in Arabic foliation. Furthermore, the same hand has supplied, below the Tamil letters, Latin transcriptions in ink (with indication of the length of the vowels). This was done most probably by/for a French speaker, as shown, e.g., in the ka series (f3r), where ka க kā கா ki கி kī கீ are transcribed as că, cā, quĭ, quī. This later hand also added commas between the individual letters as the alphabet is given in scriptio continua.
The bundle contains between the two woodcovers:
U2: 20 folios, parallel Tamil foliation 1‒20 and later added Arabic foliation 1‒20 = syllabary. 1 line per page (very big letters).
U3: 1 folio, Arabic foliation 21 added in ink in the left margin = flyleaf.
Paratexts: marginal benediction; addenda by a later hand.

U2, folio 1, recto and verso = incipit: marginal benediction; series of initial vowels.
(f1r, lm) kurupātan tuṇai
(f1r) A Ā I Ī U Ū E Ē
(f1v) AI O Ō AU ḵ {line-filler}

U2, folio 20, recto and verso = excipit: the ṉa series.
(f20r) ṉa ṉā ṉi ṉī ṉu ṉū ṉe ṉē ṉai
(f20v) ṉo ṉō ṉau {line-filler?} ṉ
Abbreviations. c = column, f = folio, lm = left margin, r = recto, rm = right margin, U = unit (codicological and/or textual), v = verso.
Unmarked puḷḷi, ō, and ē restored. Uppercase for initial vowels (in excerpts only).
